reviewText: I have been a Duke and thereafter all Dodgers fan since I was six years old.  I am thrilled to have hin featured in the most of these segments.  I grieve Ebbets Field and want to get fans together to get Gil and Peewee in the halls of Cooperstown.  Gil especially !!!!!!!!!!!!  The Boys of Summer are long over due to be in that place of reverence for real stars at the game.
brooklyn dodgers  you need more the espn series also

Great DVD for Brookyn Dodger fans. It was good to see so many baseball legends. A lot of them were interviewed and since many of them are passed away, this footage is priceless.
These were the days when baseball opened the barriers of racism and Jackie Robinson became a Brooklyn Dodger. Important piece of baseball history.
Good thing I only rented this film since there is no sound through the entire film, I know it's not my iPad with the problem since everything on my watch list is fine, just this video has no sound.
My dad said it was just all right.  He preferred the books i gave him on the dodgers instead.  I guess ken burns cant be beat.
